com.vaadin.polymer.iron

Interface IronFitBehavior


  • @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface IronFitBehavior

    Polymer.IronFitBehavior fits an element in another element using max-height and max-width, and
    optionally centers it in the window or another element.

    The element will only be sized and/or positioned if it has not already been sized and/or positioned
    by CSS.

    CSS properties Action
    position set Element is not centered horizontally or vertically
    top or bottom set Element is not vertically centered
    left or right set Element is not horizontally centered
    max-height set Element respects max-height
    max-width set Element respects max-width

    Polymer.IronFitBehavior can position an element into another element using
    verticalAlign and horizontalAlign. This will override the element’s css position.

      <div class="container">
     <iron-fit-impl vertical-align="top" horizontal-align="auto">
       Positioned into the container
     </iron-fit-impl>
   </div>

    Use noOverlap to position the element around another element without overlapping it.

      <div class="container">
     <iron-fit-impl no-overlap vertical-align="auto" horizontal-align="auto">
       Positioned around the container
     </iron-fit-impl>
   </div>

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void center()
      Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned.
      void constrain()
      Constrains the size of the element to fitInto by setting max-height
      and/or max-width.
      void fit()
      Positions and fits the element into the fitInto element.
      boolean getAutoFitOnAttach()
      Set to true to auto-fit on attach.
      boolean getDynamicAlign()
      If true, it will use horizontalAlign and verticalAlign values as preferred alignment
      and if there’s not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getFitInto()
      The element to fit this into.
      String getHorizontalAlign()
      The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
      relative to the positionTarget.
      double getHorizontalOffset()
      The same as setting margin-left and margin-right css properties.
      boolean getNoOverlap()
      Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getPositionTarget()
      The element that should be used to position the element.
      com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getSizingTarget()
      The element that will receive a max-height/width.
      String getVerticalAlign()
      The orientation against which to align the element vertically
      relative to the positionTarget.
      double getVerticalOffset()
      The same as setting margin-top and margin-bottom css properties.
      void position()
      Positions the element according to horizontalAlign, verticalAlign.
      void refit()
      Equivalent to calling resetFit() and fit().
      void resetFit()
      Resets the target element’s position and size constraints, and clear
      the memoized data.
      void setAutoFitOnAttach(boolean value)
      Set to true to auto-fit on attach.
      void setDynamicAlign(boolean value)
      If true, it will use horizontalAlign and verticalAlign values as preferred alignment
      and if there’s not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.
      void setFitInto(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)
      The element to fit this into.
      void setHorizontalAlign(String value)
      The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
      relative to the positionTarget.
      void setHorizontalOffset(double value)
      The same as setting margin-left and margin-right css properties.
      void setNoOverlap(boolean value)
      Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.
      void setPositionTarget(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)
      The element that should be used to position the element.
      void setSizingTarget(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)
      The element that will receive a max-height/width.
      void setVerticalAlign(String value)
      The orientation against which to align the element vertically
      relative to the positionTarget.
      void setVerticalOffset(double value)
      The same as setting margin-top and margin-bottom css properties.

      • getPositionTarget

        @JsProperty
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getPositionTarget()

        The element that should be used to position the element. If not set, it will
        default to the parent node.

        JavaScript Info:

      • setPositionTarget

        @JsProperty
void setPositionTarget(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)

        The element that should be used to position the element. If not set, it will
        default to the parent node.

        JavaScript Info:

      • getSizingTarget

        @JsProperty
com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject getSizingTarget()

        The element that will receive a max-height/width. By default it is the same as this,
        but it can be set to a child element. This is useful, for example, for implementing a
        scrolling region inside the element.

        JavaScript Info:

      • setSizingTarget

        @JsProperty
void setSizingTarget(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject value)

        The element that will receive a max-height/width. By default it is the same as this,
        but it can be set to a child element. This is useful, for example, for implementing a
        scrolling region inside the element.

        JavaScript Info:

      • getDynamicAlign

        @JsProperty
boolean getDynamicAlign()

        If true, it will use horizontalAlign and verticalAlign values as preferred alignment
        and if there’s not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

        JavaScript Info:

      • setDynamicAlign

        @JsProperty
void setDynamicAlign(boolean value)

        If true, it will use horizontalAlign and verticalAlign values as preferred alignment
        and if there’s not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

        JavaScript Info:

String getVerticalAlign()

        The orientation against which to align the element vertically

      • constrain

        void constrain()

        Constrains the size of the element to fitInto by setting max-height
        and/or max-width.

        JavaScript Info:

      • position

        void position()

        Positions the element according to horizontalAlign, verticalAlign.

        JavaScript Info:

      • refit

        void refit()

        Equivalent to calling resetFit() and fit(). Useful to call this after
        the element or the fitInto element has been resized, or if any of the
        positioning properties (e.g. horizontalAlign, verticalAlign) is updated.
        It preserves the scroll position of the sizingTarget.

        JavaScript Info:

      • resetFit

        void resetFit()

        Resets the target element’s position and size constraints, and clear
        the memoized data.

        JavaScript Info:

      • fit

        void fit()

        Positions and fits the element into the fitInto element.

        JavaScript Info:

      • center

        void center()

        Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned. This also sets
        position:fixed.

        JavaScript Info:
